stories.text: What are some effective ways of evaluating interns at the end of their contract? I ask because we do not measure interns based on normal impact metrics as an employee. Interns are here to learn–and in turn help us learn by teaching–not affect our bottom line. So what are some good quantifiable ways to determine if they're a good fit to convert to a job offer?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you go about evaluating interns at the end of their contract?

stories.text: Do you know any tech cooperatives that managed to go through an accelerator? I’m interested in the business model developed around it.
stories.title: Ask HN: Any examples of tech co-op business that went through an accelerator?
World’s fairs acted as showcases for American cocktail ingenuity

stories.text:
Bear with me ...

I am, let's say, not fully in control of all aspects of my life. But most important things either are online (bank accounts and transactions, insurance documents), are on the way there (heart rate monitors) or can be pulled together.

Let's say I want to build a dashboard for life - programmatic API access only, with some ability to "nudge" - "you have not been for a run this week", or "why not email that guy you last whatsapp's a year back saying let's have a coffee"

What things should be in there? What should go beyond monitoring and into nudge-ing?
stories.title: Ask HN: What luke a dashboard for life look like?
